themes.scientific_basis: Based on attachment theory (Bowlby & Ainsworth) and research on emotional security in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates the degree to which partners feel emotionally safe with each other, measuring vulnerability tolerance and emotional responsiveness

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in behavioral consistency research and trust formation studies in close relationships
themes.description: Assesses how consistently partners follow through on commitments and promises, examining patterns of dependability in both small and significant matters

themes.scientific_basis: Based on self-disclosure research and studies on openness in relationship development
themes.description: Measures the level of openness and honesty between partners, including comfort with sharing sensitive information and maintaining appropriate boundaries

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from Gottman's research on relationship repair attempts and trust rebuilding after conflicts
themes.description: Examines how couples handle trust breaches and their effectiveness in rebuilding trust through repair attempts and reconciliation

themes.scientific_basis: Based on psychological boundary theory and research on trust development in intimate relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how well partners understand, communicate, and respect each other's personal boundaries and limits

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in modern relationship research on technology use and trust in the digital age
themes.description: Assesses trust dynamics in digital communication and social media use, including privacy expectations and online behavior agreements

themes.scientific_basis: Based on perceived partner support research and its role in trust development
themes.description: Measures how partners demonstrate and perceive mutual support, examining the connection between reliable support and trust building

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from trauma-informed relationship research and studies on trust recovery
themes.description: Explores how past relationship experiences influence current trust dynamics, including strategies for overcoming trust-related challenges

themes.scientific_basis: Based on research on financial transparency and trust in romantic relationships
themes.description: Evaluates trust in financial matters, including transparency about money, shared financial decision-making, and financial fidelity

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in Dweck's growth mindset theory applied to relationship trust development
themes.description: Assesses partners' beliefs about trust as a developing quality, including their commitment to actively building and strengthening trust over time
